sen.j: 中原 猶介（なかはら なおすけ、天保3年4月8日 (旧暦)（1832年5月8日） - 慶応4年8月7日 (旧暦)（1868年9月22日））は、薩摩国（鹿児島県）出身の蘭学者・科学者・軍人。
sen.e: Naosuke NAKAHARA (May 8, 1832 - September 22, 1868) was a Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language), scientist and soldier from Satsuma Province (Kagoshima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 原文には２箇所 (旧暦) とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: Naosuke NAKAHARA (May 8, 1832 - September 22, 1868) was a rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language), scientist and soldier from Satsuma Province (modern day Kagoshima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ・rangakushaに変更 ・moderndayを追加しました。
sen.e: Naosuke NAKAHARA (May 8, 1832 - September 22, 1868) was a rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language), scientist and soldier from Satsuma Province (modern day Kagoshima Prefecture).

sen.j: 名は尚勇、号は鉄心斎。
sen.e: His given name was 尚勇, and his gago (pseudonym) was Tesshinsai.
sen.cmt: 「尚勇」読み方不明。「鉄心斎」も読み方不明ですが、"Tesshinsai"としました。
sen.e: His given name was 尚勇, and his gago (pseudonym) was Tesshinsai.
His given name was 尚勇, and his gago (pseudonym) was Tesshinsai.

sen.j: 文献によっては「猶介」に「ゆうすけ」とルビを振っているものもあるが、他に「尚介」の表記も散見されるため、「なおすけ」の読みが正しいとみられる。
sen.e: Although some literature gave the pronunciation of '猶介' as 'Yusuke,' it is considered that 'Naosuke' is correct because the name was also written as '尚介' (pronounced as Naosuke) in some other literature.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）4月8日、現在の鹿児島市上之園町（の一部、地番整理前は上荒田に属した）生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in present-day Uenosono-cho (a part of the town, in fact, which used to belong to Uearata area before the reorganization of lot numbers), Kagoshima City on May 8, 1832.
He was born in present-day Uenosono-cho (a part of the town, in fact, which used to belong to Uearata area before the reorganization of lot numbers), Kagoshima City on Apr 8, 1832.

sen.j: 幼少より蘭学や舎密学（せいみがく）に熱中した。
sen.e: He had been enthusiastic about Western studies and chemistry from childhood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 18歳にして藩命により長崎へ出向く機会を得、オランダ人から蘭学を習得した。
sen.e: He had an opportunity to go to Nagasaki under clan orders at the age of 18 and learned Western studies from Dutch teachers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had an opportunity to go to Nagasaki under clan orders at the age of 18 and learned Western studies from Dutch teachers.

sen.j: 22歳で島津斉彬に見出され、尚古集成館事業や薩摩藩水軍増兵、軍艦建造、反射炉建設の職にあたり、近代海軍の礎を築いた。
sen.e: At the age of 22, his talent attracted the attention of Nariakira SHIMAZU (the lord of Satsuma clan) so that he was involved in Shuseikan (Western-style industrial complex) project, reinforcement of the Navy of Satsuma clan, the construction of warships and a reverberatory furnace, to lay the foundations of modern navy.
sen.cmt: 原文には「尚古集成館」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「集成館」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: At the age of 22, his talent attracted the attention of Nariakira SHIMAZU (the lord of Satsuma clan), so that he was involved in Shuseikan (Western-style industrial complex) project, reinforcement of the Navy of Satsuma clan, the construction of warships and a reverberatory furnace to lay the foundations of modern navy.
sen.cmt: ・so thatの前にコンマを追加 ・to layの前のコンマを削除しました。
sen.e: At the age of 22, his talent attracted the attention of Nariakira SHIMAZU (the lord of Satsuma clan), so that he was involved in Shuseikan (Western-style industrial complex) project, reinforcement of the Navy of Satsuma clan, the construction of warships and a reverberatory furnace to lay the foundations of modern navy.

sen.j: また、薩英戦争に備えて日本初の機械水雷を開発したり、斉彬の命により薩摩切子の着色を研究し、紅色薩摩切子の製作に成功するなど、鹿児島県や日本の近代技術の面で大きな功績を残した。
sen.e: He also rendered distinguished services in modern technology of Kagoshima prefecture and Japan, by developing Japan's first torpedo as a provision for Anglo-Satsuma War, producing red Satsuma kiriko (cut-glass work) successfully by studying the coloring of Satsuma kiriko on the order of Nariakira, and so on.

He also rendered distinguished services in modern technology of Kagoshima prefecture and Japan by developing Japan's first torpedo as a provision for Anglo-Satsuma War, producing red Satsuma kiriko (cut-glass work) successfully by studying the coloring of Satsuma kiriko on the order of Nariakira and so on.
sen.cmt: ・by developingの前のコンマを削除 ・and so onの前のコンマを削除しました。

sen.j: 斉彬の死後は江戸に留学、江川英龍や安井息軒の門下で学問を取得し、のち塾頭に就任、後進育成に当たった。
sen.e: After Nariakira's death he went to Edo to study under Tarozaemon EGAWA and Sokken YASUI, and later assumed the position of the head teacher of a private school to bring up the next generation.
sen.cmt: 原文には「江川英龍」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「江川太郎左衛門」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。「学問を取得」という原文は不自然に思えますが、「学んだ」の意と解釈して訳出しました。
sen.e: After Nariakira's death, he went to Edo to study under Tarozaemon EGAWA and Sokken YASUI and later assumed the position of the head teacher of a private school to bring up the next generation.
sen.cmt: ・he wentの前にコンマを追加 ・and laterの前のコンマを削除
sen.e: After Nariakira's death, he went to Edo to study under Tarozaemon EGAWA and Sokken YASUI and later assumed the position of the head teacher of a private school to bring up the next generation.

sen.j: 息軒門下の頃、偶然に薩摩藩の蒸気軍艦が品川へ入港、息軒は猶介の案内にて艦内を一巡した。
sen.e: While Naosuke was studying under Sokken, a steam warship of Satsuma clan put in at Shinagawa by chance, and Sokken walked around the ship with Naosuke as a guide.
With a steam warship of Satsuma clan putting in at Shinagawa by chance, Naosuke, when studying under Sokken, guided Sokken around the inside of the ship.
sen.cmt: ・主語を明確にする為に文を変更しました。
sen.e: With a steam warship of Satsuma clan putting in at Shinagawa by chance, Naosuke, when studying under Sokken, guided Sokken around the inside of the ship.

sen.j: 猶介は、その軍艦は自分が建造に携わったことを、師である息軒に一言も語らなかったのであるが、息軒は後日その事実を知り、太息して猶介の人となりに膝を打ったという。
sen.e: Although Naosuke never told his teacher Sokken that he himself had a part in the construction of the warship, Sokken later learned the fact and slapped his knee in admiration for Naosuke's personality.

Although Naosuke had never told his teacher Sokken that he himself had a part in the construction of the warship, Sokken learned of this fact later and slapped his knee in admiration for Naosuke's personality.
sen.cmt: ・時制を合わせる為にhadを追加 ・携わった事実を知ったということなのでSokken learned of this fact laterに変更しました。
sen.e: Although Naosuke had never told his teacher Sokken that he himself had a part in the construction of the warship, Sokken learned of this fact later and slapped his knee in admiration for Naosuke's personality.

sen.j: 薩英戦争では長崎にて病気療養中だったが、禁門の変においては軍賦役・大砲隊長に任ぜられ、慶応2年（1866年）の長州征討の際は、長崎にて長州藩の軍備品購入の斡旋をした。
sen.e: He was recuperating in Nagasaki during Anglo-Satsuma War, but was appointed Gunbuyaku (army commander) and the commander of cannon troops in Kinmon Incident, and also used his influence to help Choshu clan purchase armaments in Nagasaki during the Second Choshu Conquest in 1866.
sen.cmt: 原文には「長州征討」とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「長州再征伐」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました（定訳不明）。
sen.e: He was recuperating in Nagasaki during Anglo-Satsuma War, but was appointed Gunbuyaku (army commander) and the commander of cannon troops in Kinmon Incident, and also used his influence to help Choshu clan purchase armaments in Nagasaki during the Second Choshu Conquest in 1866.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）、イギリス公使の薩摩藩訪問時には接待役を努め、実弾演習を指揮し披露した。
sen.e: When the envoy from England visited Satsuma clan in 1867, he took charge of reception and directed a live-ammunition exercise to show him.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）の鳥羽伏見の戦いでは、3月に新政府側の海軍参謀に任命されたが病のため一時帰郷。
sen.e: During the Battle of Toba-Fushimi in 1868, he was appointed a staff officer of the navy on the side of the new government in March, but returned briefly to his hometown because of illness.

sen.j: 6月に再出征、7月の越後長岡城の戦いに加わった。
sen.e: He went to the front again in June and joined the Battle of Nagaoka-jo Castle in Echigo Province in July.

sen.j: しかし河井継之助と対陣するうち、敵弾を右足に受け、それが因となって柏崎病院で37年の生涯を閉じた。
sen.e: However, while confronting Tsugunosuke KAWAI, he was shot in the right leg to bring his life of 37 years to a close in Kashiwazaki Hospital.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, while confronting Tsugunosuke KAWAI, he was shot in the right leg which brought his life of 37 years to a close in Kashiwazaki Hospital.

sen.j: 最期を迎えるに際しては、蘭学や科学に熱中し信仰していたにもかかわらず、天命と知るや、一切の医学的治療や投薬を退けたという。
sen.e: When his end was approaching, in spite of his absorption and belief in Western studies and sciences, he realized it was fate and refused all the medical treatments and medications.

sen.j: 鹿児島県立甲南高等学校南門に「中原猶介翁宅址碑」がある。
sen.e: There is 'The monument to the remains of the venerable Mr. Naosuke NAKAHARA's house' at the south gate of Kagoshima Prefectural Konan High School.
There is 'a monument to the remains of the venerable Mr. Naosuke NAKAHARA's residence' at the south gate of Kagoshima Prefectural Konan High School.

sen.e: There is 'a monument to the remains of the venerable Mr. Naosuke NAKAHARA's residence' at the south gate of Kagoshima Prefectural Konan High School.

sen.j: 大正5年（1916年）、鹿児島市内有志によって建立され、碑文は島津長丸男爵によるものである。
sen.e: It was built by a group of interested people in Kagoshima City in 1916 and the inscription was written by Baron Nagamaru SHIMAZU.

sen.j: 中原は翌大正6年には正五位を贈られた。
sen.e: NAKAHARA had Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) conferred upon him next year, in 1917.

sen.e: Shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) was conferred upon NAKAHARA the following year in 1917.

sen.j: 当初は現在の甲南高正門付近にあったが、1930年の甲南高の前身・鹿児島二中時代、校舎鉄筋改築の際に移築したもの。
sen.e: Originally the monument was near the present main gate of Konan High School, but was relocated in 1930 when the schoolhouse was rebuilt in ferroconcrete in the time of The Second Kagoshima Junior High School, the predecessor of Konan High School.

Although the monument had originally been near the main gate of existing Konan High School, but was relocated in 1930 when the schoolhouse was rebuilt with ferroconcrete in the time of The Second Kagoshima Junior High School, the predecessor of Konan High School.

sen.j: よしや身は 越路の雪に うづむとも とくる清水に 名をや流さむ
sen.e: Even if this present body was buried in snow in Koshiji region, I would leave a name behind me by washing it down the clear meltwater.
Even if this present body was buried in snow of Koshiji region, I would leave a name behind me by washing it down the clear water melting into the snow.
